Issues.Title: Not reset the template parser's error when using JIT compiler
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/compiler` ### Is this a regression? No sure, But got the same problem on `v9-rc.4` and `v8.2` ### Description #### Background I am using Angular to rewrite the front end of [apache/zeppelin](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/tree/web_angular), it allows users to enter dynamic templates and run, so I trying to implement this feature using the JIT compiler but blocked by this problem. #### Steps to reproduce Open the live DEMO https://ng-jit-template-parse-errors.now.sh/ and browser's console. Enter the following code in the textarea. ```html ``` Click the render button and we will see the following errors in the console, this is good because this error is expected. ``` vendor-es2015.js:40954 ERROR Error: Template parse errors: Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@0:17 (""): ng:////template.html@0:17 ``` Then enter the correct template into the textarea and click the render button again. ```html ``` Expect no error, but still got the same error. ``` vendor-es2015.js:40954 ERROR Error: Template parse errors: Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@0:17 (""): ng:////template.html@0:17 ``` I guess the error was cached, so I called the method `compiler.clearCache()`, but it still didn't work. I tried using the `ɵrenderComponent` method to render the dynamic component, the error is disappeared, but I can not use other modules (like `FormsModule`) feature in this component. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/github/hsuanxyz/ng-jit-template-parse-errors Repo: https://github.com/hsuanxyz/ng-jit-template-parse-errors/ ## 🔥 Exception or Error ``` vendor-es2015.js:40954 ERROR Error: Template parse errors: Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@2:17 (" {{name}}
"): ng:////template.html@2:17 Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@2:17 (" {{name}}
"): ng:////template.html@2:26 at syntaxError (vendor-es2015.js:10006) at htmlAstToRender3Ast (vendor-es2015.js:22123) at parseTemplate (vendor-es2015.js:24817) at CompilerFacadeImpl.compileComponent (vendor-es2015.js:25661) at Function.get (vendor-es2015.js:70705) at getComponentDef (vendor-es2015.js:37333) at assertComponentType (vendor-es2015.js:37743) at ComponentFactoryResolver$1.resolveComponentFactory (vendor-es2015.js:65766) at AppComponent.renderDynamicComponent (main-es2015.js:66) at AppComponent_Template_button_click_2_listener (main-es2015.js:83) ``` ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** ```bash Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.6 Node: 12.11.1 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 9.0.0-rc.6 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... router Ivy Workspace: Yes Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/core 9.0.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/schematics 9.0.0-rc.6 @ngtools/webpack 9.0.0-rc.6 @schematics/angular 9.0.0-rc.6 @schematics/update 0.900.0-rc.6 rxjs 6.5.3 typescript 3.6.4 webpack 4.41.2 ``` **Anything else relevant?**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Not reset the template parser's error when using JIT compiler" (#34387)

Issues.Title: Align with the optional chaining spec
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package

`@angular/compiler`

### Description

[Optional chaining](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-optional-chaining)[1] reached stage 4. We've been supporting similar syntax in templates for a while now, calling it the ["safe navigation operator"](https://angular.io/guide/template-syntax#safe-navigation-operator)[2]. For simplicity and smaller payload, we can consider aligning with the spec in future versions of the framework.

There are a couple of semantical and syntactical differences between optional chaining and safe navigation.

## Syntax 

Optional chaining has the following syntax:

```ts
obj?.prop       // optional static property access
obj?.[expr]     // optional dynamic property access
func?.(...args) // optional function or method call
```

Safe navigation supports only direct property access. Optional chaining supports this, as well as, method calls and function calls. Function calls are particularly useful in iterators:

```ts
iterator.return?.()
```

## Semantics

With optional chaining, the expression `a?.b` will be translated to `a == null ? undefined : a.b`. In Angular, the semantics of the same expression would be `null == a ? null : a.b`.

If `a` is `null` or `undefined`, the expression `typeof a?.b` would evaluate to `"object"` with optional chaining and `"undefined"` in Angular's safe navigation operator.

Except the mentioned difference above, method calls are compiled similarly:

```ts
a?.b()
a == null ? undefined : a.b()
```

In both, optional chaining and safe navigation in templates, stacking the operators is translated the same way: `(a?.b).c?.d` becomes `null == a ? null : null == a.b.c ? null : a.b.c.d`.

Another difference seems to be the way parentheses are handled. The optional chaining spec defines that `null==e.foo?null:e.foo.b.c` should be translated to `(a == null ? undefined : a.b).c`. In Angular the same expression translates to `null == a ? null : a.b.c`.

PS: looks like the last issue is fixed by https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/34221.

---

[1] Optional chaining spec https://github.com/tc39/proposal-optional-chaining
[2] Safe navigation https://angular.io/guide/template-syntax#safe-navigation-operator
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Align with the optional chaining spec" (#34385)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): improve ExpressionChangedAfterChecked error
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, the ExpressionChangedAfterChecked error thrown in Ivy was missing useful information that was available in View Engine, specifically: missing property name for property bindings and also the content of the entire property interpolation (only a changed value was displayed) if one of expressions was changed unexpectedly. This commit improves the error message by including the mentioned information into the error text.

Issues.Title: Internal compiler error on host binding with async pipe with Ivy
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Is this a regression? Yes, it works in Angular v8.2 or in v9 with Ivy disabled. ### Description In v8.2 it is possible to use the async pipe in a component's host binding to bind to an observable: ```ts @Component({ host: { '[class.active]': '(active$ | async) == true' } }) export class MyComponent { active$: Observable; } ``` But this is broken in v9. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/jonrimmer/ivy-binding-error See the instructions in the README, and the source of https://github.com/jonrimmer/ivy-binding-error/blob/master/src/app/hello.component.ts ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

ERROR in Error: Internal Error: Unexpected node
    at error (ivy-binding-error/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:2721:15)
    at ValueConverter.allocateSlot (ivy-binding-error/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:18820:88)
    at ValueConverter.visitPipe (ivy-binding-error/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:17851:29)

    at StylingBuilder._buildSingleInputs (ivy-binding-error/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:13609:20)

    at StylingBuilder.buildUpdateLevelInstructions (ivy-binding-error/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:13696:69)

Issues.Title: Routing in Angular Based Web Components using @angular/elements
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: --> This feature request is for @angular/elements and @angular/router


### Description
<!-- ✍️--> When attempting to use an Angular app to host a second Angular app wrapped as a Web Component routing does not work for the hosted app.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ✍️--> It would be nice if an instance of the hosting app could be passed in so that the router.forChild() could be used to register the routes for the web component. Another option  would be to rework both elements and router so that multiple forRoot instances of the router do not cause issues.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ✍️--> I have tried named outlets and ui-router. UI-router got me the closest by using the Angular Router in the hosting application and ui-router in the hosted component. The issue I ran into there was that I could not directly navigate by URL into a sub-route using ui-router.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Routing in Angular Based Web Components using @angular/elements" (#34377)

Issues.Title: Migration autofix not adding @Directive to intermediary component abstract classes
Issues.Body:
Testing 9.0.0-rc.6 upgrade from 8@latest

The migration logic to add @Directive to abstract classes that contain @Input is not working in all cases.

Where we have a component that has 2 layers of abstract class below it. 

The @Input is on the lowest level.

The migration adds the @Directive to the abstract class at the lowest level but it is also needed on the middle abstract class (which does not have any @Input in it).

Manually, adding the @Directive to the middle abstract class resolves the prod build error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Migration autofix not adding @Directive to intermediary component abstract classes" (#34376)

Issues.Title: Weird priority ordering on route data/resolve
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router. ### Is this a regression? I don't know. ### Description There seems to be a weird edge case in the handling of static and dynamic data of routes in the case of nested routes. Routes offer the properties `data` and `resolve` in order to attach some data, statically and dynamically respectively. For most nested route scenarios, these work as expected: `resolve` supersedes `data`, and the parents `ActivatedRoute` contains the data set on the parents route, and the childs `ActivatedRoute` contains the data set on its respective route. But there is one case where this breaks down: - The parent route loads some dynamic data via `resolve` - The child route loads some static data with the same key via `data` - The child routes relative path is `''` (i.e. empty). ``` const routes: Route[] = [ // ... { path: 'outer', component: OuterComponent, resolve: { breadcrumb: OuterResolverService }, children: [ { path: '', pathMatch: 'full', component: InnerComponent, data: { breadcrumb: 'inner' } } ] }, ]; ``` Expected behavior: - The childs corresponding `ActivatedRoute` contains the static data specified in the route (for the example above: `'inner'`), like any other child route with a different `path`. Observed behavior: - The childs corresponding `ActivatedRoute` contains the dynamically resolved data specified in the route of the parent (for the example above: whatever `OuterResolverService.resolve` returned). ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-tdz3sn ## 🔥 Exception or Error
## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 8.3.20
Node: 12.13.1
OS: win32 x64
Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.803.20
@angular-devkit/core         8.3.20
@angular-devkit/schematics   8.3.20
@schematics/angular          8.3.20
@schematics/update           0.803.20
rxjs                         6.4.0
**Anything else relevant?** Seems browser-independent. Tested on Firefox 71.0 (64bit) and Edge.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Weird priority ordering on route data/resolve" (#34361)

Issues.Title: refactor(bazel): Overhaul ngc-wrapped for Ivy rollout in g3
Issues.Body:
This commit completely refactors ngc-wrapped so that it is easier to
implement changes needed for Ivy rollout in g3 in subsequent PRs.

Most importantly, the API of exported `compile()` function is greatly
simplified, with many redundant parameters such as `tsHost` removed.

Issues.Title: XML prolog data being printed when including SVG in `templateUrl`
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Since v8 we have been able to reference SVG files in the `templateUrl` of a component. However, if the the SVG includes an XML declaration, Angular prints the declaration on the screen and then displays the SVG as expected. Since XML prolog data is valid in an SVG file, but not for inline SVG elements in html, I would expect the compiler to strip out all XML prolog data when compiling SVG files. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction 1. ``` ng new svg-app --defaults ng g component svg --module app ``` 2. Rename `svg.component.html` to `svg.component.svg` and replace contents with: ``` ``` >*SVG copied from https://github.com/google/material-design-icons/blob/master/file/svg/design/ic_attachment_18px.svg?short_path=2fb6055* 3. Update the `templateUrl` in `svg.component.ts` to be `./svg.component.svg` 4. Add the `` element tag to `app.component.html` 5. ng serve ## 🔥 Exception or Error

Issues.Title: @angular-devkit/build-angular upgrade breaks HMR
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ x ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->

yes HMR works fine with package version:

    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.800.0",


### Description

following package version is breaking HMR on a reverse proxied angular app used in conjunction with config specified in the "Environment Section" of this post.

    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "~0.803.20",

Create-react-app generated package.json (breaks HMR)

```
{
  "name": "myapp",
  "version": "0.0.0",
  "scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",
    "start": "ng serve --host 0.0.0.0 --port 3601 --disable-host-check --public-host https://mydomain.com/myapp/",
    "build": "ng build",
    "test": "ng test",
    "lint": "ng lint",
    "e2e": "ng e2e"
  },
  "private": true,
  "dependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/common": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/compiler": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/core": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/forms": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/router": "~8.2.14",
    "rxjs": "~6.4.0",
    "tslib": "^1.10.0",
    "zone.js": "~0.9.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "~0.803.20",
    "@angular/cli": "~8.3.20",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "~8.2.14",
    "@angular/language-service": "~8.2.14",
    "@types/node": "~8.9.4",
    "@types/jasmine": "~3.3.8",
    "@types/jasminewd2": "~2.0.3",
    "codelyzer": "^5.0.0",
    "jasmine-core": "~3.4.0",
    "jasmine-spec-reporter": "~4.2.1",
    "karma": "~4.1.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "~2.2.0",
    "karma-coverage-istanbul-reporter": "~2.0.1",
    "karma-jasmine": "~2.0.1",
    "karma-jasmine-html-reporter": "^1.4.0",
    "protractor": "~5.4.0",
    "ts-node": "~7.0.0",
    "tslint": "~5.15.0",
    "typescript": "~3.5.3"
  }
}
```

I can fix HMR with:    
     "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.800.0",


## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

HMR is broken using the package.json created by react-app. I can fix HMR replacing build-angular and cli with regressed versions above.

## 🔥 Exception or Error

Using the later (broken) versions of devkit and cli the path appears to be correct e.g.mydomain.com/myapp/sockjs-node/info?### but the call results in error 404 file not found 

error is initiated by **zone-evergreen,js line 2952.**

## 🌍 Your Environment

I have some simple additional configuration to make this work behind reverse nginx proxy

nginx configuration (enables HMR used with package.json above):

```
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name angular.syntapse.co.uk;
     location ^~ /myapp/sockjs-node/ {
        proxy_pass http://0.0.0.0:3601/sockjs-node/;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;
     }
     location ^~ /myapp/ {
        proxy_pass http://0.0.0.0:3601/;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;
     }
}

```
index.html (enables HMR used with package.json above)

```
<head>
  <!-- also configure: nginx locations and package.json --public-host setting -->
  <base href="/myapp/" />
   ... etc
</head>

```

thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@angular-devkit/build-angular upgrade breaks HMR" (#16410)

Issues.Title: Build SSR, ERROR in Can't bind to 'cropImageURL' since it isn't a known property of 'vimbo-cropper'
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🐞 Bug report

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Description
I am trying to build using SSR, but I am getting the error as if the properties do not exist in the component, but you can see the image below, which exists.

![Captura de Tela_selecionar área_20191212142350](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11314585/70734499-1b5a0c80-1ceb-11ea-8168-a80d09b2b13c.png)

in development mode `ng serve` everything works.


## 🔥 Exception or Error

Issues.Body:

Hi all, 

Looks like there's an npm audit issue dependant on serialize-javascript.  Currently the dependency is set to v 1.9.1, seems to be resolved in >=2.1.1  

Any eta on if we can update the dependency?

RE: https://npmjs.com/advisories/1426

 Moderate        Cross-Site Scripting
  Package         serialize-javascript
  Patched in      >=2.1.1
  Dependency of   @angular-devkit/build-angular [dev]
  Path            @angular-devkit/build-angular > copy-webpack-plugin > serialize-javascript

  More info       https://npmjs.com/advisories/1426

Please read https://angular.io/guide/security#report-issues on how to disclose security related issues.

🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑

Issues.Title: doc: adds "PR action: merge" label
Issues.Body:
This label should be placed by the author (or last reviewer if author is not a collaborator) when the PR is complete and ready to merged. This requires the author to explicitly acknolwedge that they are done with the PR and the caretaker is free to merge it. This label brings the CLI caretaking process into alignment with the frameworks and components repos.

A more automated solution is desired but difficult due to google3 merging challenges. That would be a separate problem, but this should at least get the Angular organization to a more consistent state and we can revisit that challenge when we get to it.

I chose to link to the existing PR target definitions in the framework docs, let me know if I should duplicate this for the CLI.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "doc: adds "PR action: merge" label" (#16413)

Issues.Title: Add option extractCss for builder @angular-devkit/build-angular:server
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request

`--extractCss` is supported for browser builds but when we specify extractCss in configurations of
`@angular-devkit/build-angular:server` it throws below error:

`Schema validation failed with the following errors:
  Data path "" should NOT have additional properties(extractCss).`

Sometimes we want server to return just clean html without any styles embedded in html document, especially when we are already sending css file using HTTP/2 Server Push from the server along with the response. In this case the styles embedded in the html are redundant and increase page size (in my case ~24kb of css is added in html response).

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
```
- [x ] build
```

### Describe the solution you'd like
`--extractCss` should work with `@angular-devkit/build-angular:server`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add option extractCss for builder @angular-devkit/build-angular:server" (#16411)

Issues.Title: angular build artifacts is unstable
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🐞 Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->

No

### Description

Different machine and different node version build with different artifacts. (different file hash and different file content)

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

* install docker (my docker version is mac docker desktop community 2.1.0.5(40693))
* `git clone https://github.com/xiaoxiangmoe/angular-hash-problem.git`  (this repo is an empty repo create by ng-cli new)
* `cd angular-hash-problem`
* `docker run --rm --interactive --tty --mount type=bind,source="$(pwd)",target=/workspace node:13.3.0-alpine /bin/sh`
* `cd workspace/`
* `yarn build --prod`

it generate:

```
Generating ES5 bundles for differential loading...
ES5 bundle generation complete.

chunk {0} runtime-es2015.e59a6cd8f1b6ab0c3f29.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered]
chunk {0} runtime-es5.e59a6cd8f1b6ab0c3f29.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered]
chunk {2} polyfills-es2015.58725a5910daef768ca8.js (polyfills) 36 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {3} polyfills-es5.c7f38740d119d1d125aa.js (polyfills-es5) 125 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {1} main-es2015.9f2a69a2a7ce2c1f668b.js (main) 215 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {1} main-es5.9f2a69a2a7ce2c1f668b.js (main) 258 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {4} styles.0e4338761429b4eb16ac.css (styles) 0 bytes [initial] [rendered]
Date: 2019-12-10T03:43:32.228Z - Hash: 6aed27717e970881a87c - Time: 59765ms
```
when we build it in same node version in mac. it generate same result.

but if we build it in different node version in docker. it generate different hash, for example node:10.16.1-alpine

```
Generating ES5 bundles for differential loading...
ES5 bundle generation complete.

chunk {0} runtime-es2015.e59a6cd8f1b6ab0c3f29.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered]
chunk {0} runtime-es5.e59a6cd8f1b6ab0c3f29.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered]
chunk {2} polyfills-es2015.58725a5910daef768ca8.js (polyfills) 36 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {3} polyfills-es5.c7f38740d119d1d125aa.js (polyfills-es5) 125 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {1} main-es2015.9f2a69a2a7ce2c1f668b.js (main) 215 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {1} main-es5.9f2a69a2a7ce2c1f668b.js (main) 258 kB [initial] [rendered]
chunk {4} styles.0e4338761429b4eb16ac.css (styles) 0 bytes [initial] [rendered]
Date: 2019-12-10T04:00:33.003Z - Hash: 6aed27717e970881a87c - Time: 29734ms
```

---

also, if we run `yarn build` without `--prod`, we will found full directory in `main-es5.js`:

```
function _(module, exports, __webpack_require__) {
    module.exports = __webpack_require__(
    /*! /Users/zhaojinxiang/codes/angular-hash-problem/src/main.ts */
    "./src/main.ts");
    /***/
  }
```

if we move project from `~/codes/angular-hash-problem` into `~/repos/angular-hash-problem`, it will generate different artifacts

---

in conclusion:

* crossing operating system: stable in some specific version of node(node 13), unstable between node 10
* crossing node version: unstable between node 10 and node 11, stable between node 11,12 and 13.
* crossing directory: stable in `--prod` and unstable in `--prod=false`

Issues.Body:
`<mat-menu>` doesn't have an API that lets the user set an `aria-label` on the `role="menu"` element.

Issues.Title: Exiting Menu Component via screen-reader for iOS jumps user to top/bottom of page
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Issue is easily reproducible in the Angular Material documentation using iOS VoiceOver: https://material.angular.io/components/menu/overview

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to https://material.angular.io/components/menu/overview using an iOS device with the VoiceOver native screen reader enabled.
2. Swipe-navigate to the component example for the Menu (see screenshot at end of section).
3. Double-tap to activate and open menu - focus will move to first item of the menu (on occasion, the menu immediately closes instead).
4a. Swipe back once to navigate back out of the menu - observe that focus is moved to the bottom of the DOM.
4b. OR swipe forward twice to navigate past the last menu item to move past menu to next part of the document - observe that focus is instead directed to the top of the DOM.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1666565/70722343-1b471600-1cc5-11ea-805c-8391b4ffddab.png) 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
1. Swipe-navigating back out of the menu should allow a user to either navigate back to the menu button they activated, or focus should select the menu element, which can close on double tap as the menu functions using Android TalkBack.
2. Swipe-navigating past the last item of the menu should move the user's focus to the next element in the DOM past the original menu item.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
When opening the Menu Component using iOS VoiceOver, the only means of navigating away from the menu are:
1. Navigate to the top of the DOM
2. Navigate to the bottom of the DOM
3. Tap off the menu to select another part of the document (users who depend on screen readers would lose place in document)

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14 (assuming this is what is used on the Angular Material documentation)
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome 79.0.3945.73 for iOS, Safari 13 for iOS
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iOS 13.3

#### Technical Notes
This is due to the menu being generated dynamically at the bottom of the DOM, instead of placement relative to the host element. This interrupts normal tab flow throughout the document, which would create confusion for users.

Possible solutions would be to implement the same functionality seen using Android TalkBack (menu element as a whole is selectable when swiping back, and closable on double-tap), or to relocate the menu's generation to be relative to the host menu button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Exiting Menu Component via screen-reader for iOS jumps user to top/bottom of page" (#17951)

Issues.Title: fix(dialog): DOM nodes not cleaned up if view container is destroyed before close animation starts
Issues.Body:
Currently the dialog's cleanup logic is tied to its exit animation completing and the close animation starting. This usually isn't a problem since by default the dialog is attached to the application ref, however if the consumer has set a viewContainerRef and that ref is destroyed before animation even starts, the exit animation event will never fire. These changes add a timeout as a fallback in case the animation doesn't start.

Fixes #17891.

Issues.Title: Option to disable focus on bottom sheets
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Currently if `autoFocus` is disabled the focus is still being set to the container:

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/45d34ad4ff85d36096df5ccef1b1f5658364372d/src/material/bottom-sheet/bottom-sheet-container.ts#L206-L215

It would be really useful to disable focus capturing entirely.

#### Use Case

In my case the bottom sheet is triggered by changing the value of a text input - which results in losing focus as soon as the bottom sheet opens.

As a workaround I'm saving the previously selected element and reset the focus to this element within `afterOpened`. The disadvantage of this workaround is that if you're switching focus before the bottom sheet is completely opened (e.g. by hitting tab) the focus is reset to the wrong element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Option to disable focus on bottom sheets" (#17944)

Issues.Title: Dates 'YYYY-MM-DD' parsed as UTC and  'MM/DD/YYYY' as local timezone
Issues.Body: #### Bug: When calling `new Date()` on a string, a date of the form 'YYYY-MM-DD' is parsed as UTC meanwhile a date of the form 'MM/DD/YYYY' is parsed in local timezone. #### What is the expected behavior? All dates including 'YYYY-MM-DD' should be parsed as local timezone. E.g. both of these: `new Date('12/10/2019')` and `new Date('2019-12-10')` should give (assuming you're in PST): ``` Tue Dec 10 2019 00:00:00 GMT-0800 (Pacific Standard Time) ``` #### What is the current behavior? `new Date('12/10/2019')` gives ``` Tue Dec 10 2019 00:00:00 GMT-0800 (Pacific Standard Time) ``` Meanwhile `new Date('2019-12-10')` gives ``` Mon Dec 09 2019 16:00:00 GMT-0800 (Pacific Standard Time) ``` Therefore if attempting to extract back the date, in the second case a date of December 10 ends up as December 9. #### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? It's inconsistent and unexpected behavior, which can lead to code that is error-prone. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? All as far as I can tell.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dates 'YYYY-MM-DD' parsed as UTC and  'MM/DD/YYYY' as local timezone" (#17931)
